data.title: DNA double helix repair
data.statement:
DNA sequence is a double helix consisting of 2 strands. The genetic letters are A, C, G and T (Adenine, Cytosine, Guanine, Thymine). These letters always connect in pairs between the two strands of a double helix. A with T and C with G, which means if you have an A at position x of a strand, then you must have a T at the same position of the opposing strand.

The DNA sequence has to be repaired by <<replacing all occurrences of a bad gene with the good gene>>. The output has to be the repaired DNA sequence.

There are no test cases containing invalid inputs.

Note: The bad gene can appear on either (or both) of the two strands.

Visualization of two strands of a double helix:

`C-G-A-T-T-G-C-G-A-T-T-C
| | | | | | | | | | | |
G-C-T-A-A-C-G-C-T-A-A-G`
data.stubGenerator:
read badGene:string(12)
read goodGene:string(12)
read strand1:string(1024)
read strand2:string(1024)
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> A string [[badGene]] which is the defect gene
<<Line 2:>> A string [[goodGene]] which is the good gene
<<Line 3:>> A string [[strand1]] which is the strand 1 of the double helix
<<Line 4:>> A string [[strand2]] which is the corresponding strand 2 of the double helix
data.outputDescription:
<<Line 1 :>> The repaired strand1 of the double helix
<<Line 2 :>> The corresponding, repaired  strand2 of the double helix

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

DNA sequence is a double helix consisting of 2 strands. The genetic letters are A, C, G and T (Adenine, Cytosine, Guanine, Thymine). These letters always connect in pairs between the two strands of a double helix. A with T and C with G, which means if you have an A at position x of a strand, then you must have a T at the same position of the opposing strand.

The DNA sequence has to be repaired by replacing all occurrences of a bad gene with the good gene. The output has to be the repaired DNA sequence.

There are no test cases containing invalid inputs.

Note: The bad gene can appear on either (or both) of the two strands.

Visualization of two strands of a double helix:

C-G-A-T-T-G-C-G-A-T-T-C
| | | | | | | | | | | |
G-C-T-A-A-C-G-C-T-A-A-G
Input
Line 1: A string badGene which is the defect gene
Line 2: A string goodGene which is the good gene
Line 3: A string strand1 which is the strand 1 of the double helix
Line 4: A string strand2 which is the corresponding strand 2 of the double helix
Output
Line 1 : The repaired strand1 of the double helix
Line 2 : The corresponding, repaired strand2 of the double helix
Constraints
length of badGene, goodGene <= 12
length of strand1, strand2 <= 1024
Example
Input
CGA
CGT
CGATTG
GCTAAC
Output
CGTTTG
GCAAAC
